meanings.definition: In a manner relating to or based on experimentation.
meanings.sent1: She tested the hypothesis experimentally in the lab.
meanings.sent2: The scientist conducted the research experimentally to gather data.
meanings.sent3: The curious cat experimentally pawed at the new toy.
meanings.sent4: Her approach to problem-solving was to tackle it experimentally.
meanings.sent5: The students learned best when they were taught experimentally through hands-on activities.

meanings.definition: In a way that involves conducting experiments.
meanings.sent1: He carefully followed the procedure experimentally to ensure accuracy.
meanings.sent2: The team of researchers worked experimentally to test their hypothesis.
meanings.sent3: The chef experimentally combined unusual ingredients to create a new dish.
meanings.sent4: The athlete trained experimentally to improve performance.
meanings.sent5: The students observed the chemical reaction experimentally in the science lab.

meanings.sent1: The medication's effectiveness was determined experimentally through trials.
meanings.sent2: The engineer solved the problem experimentally by trying different solutions.
meanings.sent3: The artist experimentally mixed colors to achieve the desired shade.
meanings.sent4: The teacher encouraged students to learn experimentally through hands-on projects.
meanings.sent5: The new technology was developed experimentally in the research facility.
